column4: Task
Kickoff call with estate attorney to outline trust and FLP formation; provide necessary information and schedule deliverables.
Estate attorney drafts irrevocable trust; send documents for review; schedule call for finalization.
Review and sign trust documents; file with state; maintain copies.
Attorney drafts family limited partnership (FLP) agreement and prepares GP/LP structure; review terms.
Form HoldCo (WY/DE LLC) and apply for EIN; open bank account.
column8: HoldCo formed and bank account opened

column4: Form Management Company (S-Corp LLC) and apply for EIN; hold organizational meeting; adopt operating agreement.
Form Real Estate Holding LLC (series or state-specific); apply for EIN; open bank account.
column8: REI LLC formed and bank account opened

column4: Form other subsidiaries (ServiceCo, IP/MediaCo, EquipCo etc.); file appropriate documents; apply for EINs.
Determine trust beneficiaries and trustees; sign letters; designate trust protector.
Transfer initial capital contributions into trust and FLP; record transactions; maintain documentation.
Hold meeting with corporate attorney to finalize operating agreements for all entities; sign documents.
Register for necessary state business licenses and permits; file UCC filings; register trade names.
Set up accounting system for HoldCo and MgmtCo; create chart of accounts; assign roles.
Acquire domain and set up dedicated email addresses for entities; implement secure document storage and password manager.
Kickoff orientation session with all advisors (estate attorney, corporate attorney, CPA, consultants) to outline upcoming tasks and timelines.
Draft and execute assignment of ownership interests to the trust and FLP; update membership records.
Transfer ownership of IP (patents, trademarks, domains) to IP/MediaCo via assignment agreement.
Transfer equipment assets to EquipCo; record valuations; update insurance coverage.
Transfer personal property (vehicles, furniture) into appropriate entities; update insurance policies.
Execute property deeds transferring real estate holdings to RealEstateCo; record with county clerk.
Transfer brokerage and investment accounts to HoldCo; coordinate with brokerage; update beneficiary designations.
Contribute initial equity to ServiceCos; record capital contributions; update membership units.
Form and fund children's trust; assign LP units; open bank accounts for trusts.
Set up plan-owned LLC for Solo 401(k); apply for EIN; open bank account.
Transfer initial 401(k) assets; document rollovers; ensure compliance with IRS rules.
Evaluate and transfer life insurance policies into ILIT; confirm coverage amounts and beneficiary designations.
Transfer intangible assets (domains, software code) to IP/MediaCo; update registrars and repositories.
Transfer vendor contracts and service agreements from personal names to appropriate entities; update contact information.
Conduct meeting to review all asset transfer documentation; ensure valuations, filings, and insurance are updated.
Update trust schedule of assets; finalize capital contributions; ensure all accounts funded and records are accurate.
column8: Trust and FLP capital schedule finalized

column4: Draft Master Services Agreement (MSA) between MgmtCo and each subsidiary; define scope, fees, and service levels.
Review and finalize MSA with all parties; obtain signatures and store signed copies.
Draft Intellectual Property (IP) License Agreement between IP/MediaCo and ServiceCos; outline royalties and license scope.
Review and execute IP License; record intangible asset valuations; set up royalty billing.
Draft Equipment Lease Agreement between EquipCo and operating entities; set market lease rates.
Review and sign equipment leases; set up monthly invoicing; update depreciation schedules.
column8: Equipment leases executed and invoicing configured

column4: Draft Intercompany Loan Agreement for funding between HoldCo and subsidiaries; determine interest rates and terms.
Review and finalize loan agreements; sign promissory notes; record in books.
Draft Cost-Sharing Agreement for shared services (software, HR, marketing); allocate percentages.
Execute cost-sharing agreements; integrate allocation percentages into accounting software.
Build Chart of Accounts across all entities; ensure uniform coding for consolidation.
Configure accounting software for each entity; input Chart of Accounts; set up categories.
Set up intercompany accounting procedures; train bookkeeper and staff; test internal transactions.
Document transfer pricing policies; prepare transfer pricing memo; schedule annual review.
Perform initial internal audit of intercompany agreements and accounts; review compliance and adjust as needed.
column8: Internal audit completed and adjustments made

column4: Work with CPA to finalize Solo 401(k) plan documents; ensure eligibility and plan adoption.
Sign Solo 401(k) plan adoption agreement; designate trustees; ensure plan is effective.
Set up contributions schedule for 401(k); decide on employee and employer contributions; implement payroll deferral.
Consult ERISA specialist to ensure plan compliance; review prohibited transactions; finalize plan trust.
Work with insurance advisor to structure ILIT; choose policy; confirm premium schedule.
Fund ILIT with initial gift; send Crummey notice to beneficiaries; deposit funds into ILIT trust.
Design philanthropic strategy with foundation board; define mission, programs, and scholarship criteria.
Draft bylaws for 501(c)(3) foundation; hold initial board meeting; elect officers and adopt policies.
File IRS Form 1023 for nonprofit status; draft state registration documents; prepare budgets for programs.
Set up foundation bank account; deposit seed funding; plan first philanthropic activities.
column8: Foundation funded and bank account opened

column4: Draft and adopt conflict-of-interest policy for foundation; ensure board approval.
Develop donation acceptance policy; create process for donors; publish policy on website.
Explore charitable remainder trust (CRT) opportunities; consult attorney; plan contributions.
Identify high-value appreciated assets; schedule sale or transfer to CRT; coordinate with CPA and attorney.
Evaluate establishing cash balance plan for additional retirement savings; gather proposals; schedule meeting with actuary.
Conduct board meeting for HoldCo and subsidiaries; approve policies, budgets, and compensation packages.
Finalize governance charter; define decision rights; update trust protector instructions.
Ensure all entities have registered agents and up-to-date annual reports filed; file necessary reports.
column8: Registered agents and annual reports in place

column4: Secure general liability, E&O, cyber, and umbrella insurance for each entity; update coverage for new assets.
Create central compliance calendar listing all deadlines (tax filings, state filings, insurance renewals, board meetings).
Set up monthly accounting close process; assign responsibilities to CFO or bookkeeper; create closing checklist.
Implement internal controls for cash management; dual signatures; approval thresholds.
Develop risk management program; identify risk categories; assign owners for each risk.
Establish document retention and destruction policy; implement document management system.
Train staff and board on fiduciary responsibilities; hold orientation session.
Create RACI matrix for governance tasks; designate responsible and accountable persons for each duty.
Outline board meeting cadence; schedule quarterly board meetings; prepare agenda templates.
Prepare first quarterly management report; compile financial statements; analyze KPIs and present to board.
Conduct Solo 401(k) plan compliance review; ensure contributions are on track; schedule non-discrimination testing.
Review philanthropic activities; ensure foundation meets 5% distribution requirement; implement distribution strategy.
Prepare for first round of R&D tax credit study; gather relevant data; coordinate with consultants.
Conduct asset valuation; review FLP values; update for gifting and estate planning; evaluate additional contributions.
Review trust funding; ensure all assets are properly titled in name of trust and FLP; correct any issues.
Review insurance coverage; adjust for new assets and liabilities; confirm property coverage is adequate.
Conduct transfer pricing review; adjust royalty, lease, and management fees based on benchmarks.
Review state tax nexus; ensure compliance across states; plan for multi-state filings.
Document intercompany meeting minutes; store in compliance binder; ensure record-keeping is complete.
Prepare training materials for upcoming SuiteDash and Neat Circle onboarding; finalize training schedule.
Finalize process flow diagrams for major operations; publish to internal intranet.
Conduct security audit; update password policies; implement multi-factor authentication for all systems.
Test business continuity plan; run table-top scenario; evaluate resilience of operations.
Prepare annual audit plan; select external CPA firm; set timeline for audit activities.
Review philanthropic board minutes; ensure governance policies are followed; address any issues.
Summarize governance review outcomes; assign action items; schedule follow-up meetings.
Celebrate completion of foundation phase; hold team meeting; review successes and challenges; prepare for next phase.
Kickoff SuiteDash project with consultants; define scope and timeline; assign roles to team members.
Collect legacy data from existing systems (contacts, projects, invoices); plan migration strategy.
Set up SuiteDash portal; create organization; configure global settings and enable necessary modules.
Customize CRM fields and custom fields; map to data dictionary; replicate column definitions.
Import contacts and companies; verify data integrity; assign account managers.
Create project templates for typical services; add tasks, due dates, and dependencies.
Configure automations for lead capture; set triggers for tasks, emails, and notifications.
Set up portal roles and permissions; assign access to staff, contractors, and clients.
Set up billing module; integrate with payment gateway; configure invoicing templates and recurring billing.
Create knowledge base; develop training materials; build FAQs and import SOPs into SuiteDash.
Test CRM workflows; run through a sample project; check triggers and automations.
Train internal team on SuiteDash usage; hold interactive sessions; gather feedback.
Migrate ticketing and support data; configure support channels; set service-level agreements (SLAs).
Build dashboards to monitor KPIs; set up real-time reporting; assign custom views per department.
Create time tracking and resource allocation modules; test time entry workflows; integrate with payroll.
Configure client portals; customize branding; invite small group of clients to pilot test.
Create marketing automation sequences; integrate with email provider; test sequences for accuracy.
Integrate SuiteDash with other tools (QuickBooks, Slack, email); test integration flows and data synchronization.
Conduct user acceptance testing across all modules; fix issues; refine and polish implementation.
Finalize migration; confirm all data migrated; conduct cutover from legacy systems and retire old platforms.
column8: SuiteDash fully live and legacy systems shut down

column4: Identify service packages to deploy (customer support, marketing, business systems, growth, industry solutions) from Neat Circle scope document.
Create project plan for each service package; define tasks, deliverables, and timeline.
Onboard vendor partners necessary for service packages (call center, marketing specialists, etc.).
Implement customer support service package; set up help desk; define escalation paths and response times.
Train staff on customer support processes; set up knowledge base; implement chat/phone support.
Launch marketing & sales service package; design campaign templates; integrate with SuiteDash.
Set up business systems service package; automate workflows for process automation, training, and platform customization.
Implement growth systems service package; design growth pipeline, business operating systems, and quick-start solutions.
Set up industry solutions (construction management, manufacturing systems, etc.); tailor each vertical to your industries.
Configure metrics and reporting for each package; integrate with SuiteDash dashboards.
Train internal team on using each service package; provide step-by-step guidance and materials.
Test service delivery by running a small pilot with a selected client; gather feedback.
Adjust packages based on feedback; refine documentation, pricing, and processes.
Develop marketing materials and product pages for selling service packages to external clients.
Formalize pricing strategy for each package; prepare sales scripts and proposals.
Integrate packages with billing and subscription management; enable recurring revenue capture in SuiteDash.
Set up performance monitoring; create dashboards for service package usage and conversion rates.
Train sales team on cross-selling packages; provide training on features, benefits, and ROI.
column8: Sales team prepared to sell packages

column4: Launch service packages publicly; announce to clients and prospects; open new marketing channels.
Review initial results; analyze package adoption metrics; plan next enhancements and improvements.
Kickoff ToriMedia campaign planning; define goals, target audiences, and messaging for each vertical.
Create brand style guide; choose colors, fonts, tone; align across brands and entities.
Develop creative assets including logos, templates, and landing pages for each vertical.
Produce high-quality content pieces such as blog posts and articles; leverage ToriMedia writers and designers.
Create social media calendar; plan posts, stories, lives; schedule across platforms.
Launch video production process: script, film, edit explainer videos and case studies.
Engage influencers and cultivate user-generated content; create UGC campaigns and track participation.
Launch paid advertising campaigns (PPC, social media ads); set budgets and integrate with CRM leads.
Set up email marketing sequences; create nurture campaigns and follow-up templates.
Develop conversion optimization plan; create landing page A/B tests and implement improvements.
Implement analytics dashboards; connect to SuiteDash; monitor leads and conversions across channels.
Conduct SEO audit; optimize websites; fix technical issues and improve ranking.
Launch cross-promotion campaigns across directories and service packages; coordinate messaging.
Implement PR strategy; issue press release about company mission, vision, and new offerings.
Host webinars or virtual events; plan topics; invite speakers; run events and engage participants.
Monitor campaign performance; gather metrics; adjust creative strategies based on data.
Conduct community engagement initiatives; host contests; provide value to followers.
Offer referral programs; design incentives; track referrals and conversions in CRM.
Run conversion rate optimization experiments; analyze funnel drop-offs; test new offers and calls to action.
Summarize campaign outcomes; prepare detailed report; plan next quarter's campaigns and improvements.
column8: Campaign outcomes documented and next steps planned

column4: Kickoff operations harmonization project; gather data on current processes and pricing across all OpCos.
Analyze service pricing across OpCos; identify disparities and propose standard pricing models.
Review service level agreements; align across OpCos to unify service levels and expectations.
Design standard operating procedures (SOPs) for each service; document step-by-step processes.
Create central knowledge base for common procedures; centralize knowledge on SuiteDash.
Perform cost analysis; evaluate cost per service; adjust pricing strategy accordingly.
Establish margin targets; set guidelines for profitability per service; update price lists accordingly.
Consolidate vendor contracts; negotiate group pricing; reduce costs across OpCos.
Harmonize procurement processes; centralize procurement; implement approval workflows.
Align payment terms; unify billing cycles and payment methods; communicate changes to clients.
Harmonize marketing materials; standardize brand voice; unify brochures and proposals across OpCos.
Conduct staff training on new pricing and operations; ensure understanding of changes.
Launch internal communications to announce changes; update staff on new pricing and operating procedures.
Implement new pricing in billing system; update subscription plans and contracts; notify clients.
Review and update legal contracts to reflect new pricing and terms; execute amendments.
Harmonize metrics and reporting; unify KPIs across OpCos; update dashboards to reflect new metrics.
Standardize customer service policies; unify refund, guarantee, and escalation policies across entities.
Conduct technology integration; unify tools; migrate duplicate systems to central platforms.
Implement quality assurance processes; schedule regular audits; assign QA manager.
Harmonize training and onboarding processes; align training materials; cross-train staff across OpCos.
Review and update HR policies; unify benefits, job descriptions, and compensation structures across entities.
Harmonize sales processes; unify proposals; train sales teams on new procedures.
Align marketing campaigns and collateral; unify cross-selling messaging across all businesses.
Perform financial reconciliations; test for consistency across entities; adjust any discrepancies.
Conduct risk assessment and compliance review; update internal controls and processes.
Align philanthropic strategies; unify mission of Origin Eyes across businesses; integrate philanthropic goals with operations.
Review and adjust budgets based on harmonization outcomes; reforecast revenues and costs.
Evaluate performance of harmonization; gather feedback from stakeholders; adjust plans accordingly.
Finalize harmonized operations; document final procedures; implement and communicate new standards.
Celebrate milestones; send communications; set expectations for upcoming scaling and governance phase.
column8: Milestones celebrated and next steps communicated

column4: Begin due diligence on first acquisition target; review financials and sign NDAs.
Engage M&A advisor; outline acquisition criteria and prepare pipeline of targets.
column8: M&A advisor engaged and criteria defined

column4: Evaluate financing options; meet with SBA lender; gather requirements for loans.
Finalize letter of intent (LOI) for first acquisition; propose purchase terms and schedule negotiation.
Perform site visit; inspect operations; meet management; gather data about target business.
Conduct quality of earnings analysis; review financial statements; identify adjustments and risks.
Draft acquisition plan; define integration timeline; allocate resources and team members.
Perform legal due diligence; review corporate documents and contracts; analyze liabilities and compliance.
Perform environmental and compliance due diligence; hire third-party inspectors; ensure environmental compliance.
Negotiate final purchase agreement; finalize terms; sign and prepare for closing.
Secure financing and capital contributions; finalize loan documents; obtain approvals and prepare for funding.
Close acquisition; sign purchase agreement; release funds; transfer ownership of the target company.
Announce acquisition; communicate to employees and stakeholders; update marketing materials.
Begin 100-day integration of new OpCo; align with integration Gantt; start onboarding processes.
Onboard new OpCo to SuiteDash; migrate data; train staff on BOS processes.
Onboard new OpCo to Neat Circle services; implement service packages and train staff.
column8: New OpCo onboarded to Neat Circle

column4: Start ToriMedia rebranding for new OpCo; design brand assets and launch announcement.
Evaluate property of new acquisition; decide on PropCo/OpCo structure; execute sale-leaseback.
Draft leaseback agreement; sign; transfer property to PropCo; record at county clerk.
Adjust pricing and operations of new OpCo to align with harmonized standards; update policies and pricing.
column8: New OpCo pricing and operations aligned

column4: Review first acquisition integration progress; track metrics; adjust integration plan accordingly.
Begin due diligence on second acquisition; replicate due diligence and assessment process.
Research potential vertical SaaS product ideas; identify market demand; start designing features.
Evaluate micro-SaaS or directory opportunities; analyze TAM; begin planning for development.
Set up product development team; allocate resources; choose technology stack for first SaaS product.
Develop features for first vertical SaaS (e.g., property management CRM); design and build core functionalities.
Conduct user interviews with early adopters; gather feedback; iterate on SaaS product features.
Work on early prototypes; test with internal team; refine features based on feedback.
Prepare marketing plan for vertical SaaS; design landing pages; create marketing copy and campaigns.
Set up subscription and payment systems for SaaS; integrate with accounting and CRM.
Develop second vertical SaaS or plugin; start building core functionalities and allocate resources.
Evaluate launching new directory vertical; research domain names; plan website and content architecture.
Build content and listings for new directory; contact potential advertisers and partners.
Create a membership model for directory; set pricing; integrate with CRM for membership management.
Start philanthropic program through Origin Eyes; select projects; allocate funding and resources.
Launch first philanthropic initiative (scholarship or community project); create marketing story and promote.
Review philanthropic program metrics; adjust giving strategy; plan next community projects.
Conduct quarterly board meeting; review performance across all entities; approve budgets and next initiatives.
Evaluate risk management program; update risk register; implement improvements based on emerging risks.
Conduct internal audit of compliance; review intercompany transactions; correct any non-compliance issues.
Begin due diligence on third acquisition; pre-screen potential targets; schedule interviews.
Finalize acquisition criteria for second quarter; update pipeline with prospects meeting the criteria.
Evaluate opportunities for cost synergies across OpCos; implement cross-selling and share resources.
Conduct annual tax planning meeting with CPA; estimate tax liabilities; identify strategies to reduce taxes.
Review retirement plan performance; adjust contributions; evaluate Cash Balance Plan adoption.
Assess technology stack; update or upgrade software; ensure cybersecurity and scalability.
Plan next round of product features; incorporate AI (RAG, LLM) to optimize workflows and decision-making.
Develop agentic service modules; integrate ChatGPT features into SuiteDash workflows and service offerings.
Write or refine training materials for new AI modules; test with staff to ensure understanding.
Launch beta of vertical SaaS; onboard pilot users; collect feedback and iterate.
Perform mid-year financial review; adjust forecasts and budgets; update board on financial health.
Explore international expansion; research legal and tax issues for potential markets; evaluate digital products for global distribution.
Evaluate opportunity to start a venture capital or angel investment arm; discuss strategy with advisors.
Plan next philanthropic event or campaign; design concept; prepare marketing and fundraising plan.
Conduct real estate strategy review; decide on acquisitions or sales; update property portfolio plan.
Prepare for year-end compliance deadlines; review calendar; assign responsibilities and gather documents.
Assess board composition; consider adding independent board members; plan recruitment.
Finalize second acquisition closing; sign purchase agreement; begin integration process.
Evaluate performance of first vertical SaaS; analyze metrics; plan product improvements and marketing adjustments.
Submit annual Form 5500 for 401(k); ensure retirement plan compliance and filing deadlines met.
Begin design of new micro-SaaS integration; incorporate user feedback and plan MVP release.
Evaluate new technology or integration for marketing automation; plan adoption and testing.
Perform final philanthropic giving for the year; meet distribution requirements and allocate funds.
Finalize budgets for next year; incorporate growth initiatives and board-approved expansions; obtain approvals.
Conduct year-end board meeting; review annual performance; approve strategic plan for next year; set goals.
Prepare for year-end tax filings; gather documents; coordinate with CPA and legal team.
Evaluate potential exit strategies for matured OpCos; discuss with advisors; evaluate sale vs. hold scenarios.
Prepare pipeline for new acquisitions next year; refresh targets; schedule due diligence phases.
Conduct staff performance reviews; plan training, promotions, and succession planning.
Evaluate adoption of generative AI for content creation; test with ToriMedia team and measure results.
Assess marketing ROI; identify the most successful channels; allocate budgets for next year accordingly.
Conduct final risk assessment; update risk register; implement control improvements.
Plan next year's philanthropic budget; allocate funds; design programs; align with mission.
Evaluate insurance policies for renewal; renew or renegotiate coverage; update policies as needed.
Finalize board agenda for next year; schedule meeting dates; prepare invitations and agendas.
Perform final compliance audit; ensure all state filings and tax filings are complete; remedy any gaps.
Review training programs and onboarding processes; update materials; implement improvements based on feedback.
Plan leadership retreat or offsite; schedule dates; design agenda and objectives.
Prepare year-end investor report; compile financials; highlight achievements and next steps; send to investors.
Finalize year-end tasks; pay final invoices; close books; ensure cash balances and reconciliations are complete.
Conduct reflection and strategic planning day; evaluate entire year's achievements; identify lessons; set goals for next year.
column8: Strategic planning for next year completed
